Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... ju-ni... kaette, ju-san...
But that can't be right!
Shigure? Are you--
Ah! Kanchou, avert your eyes at once!
You're fully dressed! And the door was open...
Mukankei! I hadn't finished these calculations. What if they're wrong? To me, it is as if you had walked in on me changing. Worse, even.

Fields.MenuText: Don't be so vain. We all make mistakes.
I'll knock next time.
But then you wouldn't have left the door open.

Fields.DialogueText: Mine could mean the difference between life and death. Though, I suppose you are in a similar situation.
Arigatō. I confess I am still not used to not being alone.
Well... sometimes I forget. I think there may be a curse on those who see me undressed, anyway.
What are you trying to calculate, anyway?
The correlation of weather patterns to Funayūrei accuracy.
Such a thing exists?
I am not convinced that it doesn't. You would be surprised what I have predicted with otherwise disparate factors.
And here I thought you were just lucky.
As did many of my sisters.
*ALARM*
Are you--
Hai. Who knows what might happen if I leave these unfinished?
@BATTLE
If I am right, Kanchou... we are in no danger at the present moment.
We should still be on our guard. The Morganas are supposed to be out in force here.
I know what the briefing says. But... you're going to laugh.
Try me.
Look at this chart. The stars said otherwise.

Fields.MenuText: Heh... ha ha ha!
What did they say, exactly?
Command doesn't employ astrologers.

Fields.DialogueText: You... you promised you wouldn't laugh, Kanchou.
That once again, I would slip through unscathed, on certain conditions.
At least they have me, right?
Oh... and the stars also say "Three paces left." That one, I am still unsure on.
Rotate that chart ninety degrees.
Nani? Oh, dear, you're right. Let me see...
Goodness.
What?
Now the stars say everyone is doomed.
Not much for moderation, are they?
They are much greater than you or I. The heavens never move but with grandeur.
I'll settle for quick and dirty in this fight.
@BATTLE
May I join you for tea?
Sumimasen! Let me make another pot - this one is not for idle drinking.
What is it for?
Do you read tea leaves, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Do you?
This is getting ridiculous.
I'll bite. What do they say?

Fields.DialogueText: On occasion, but never with intent until recently.
To one unfamiliar with the craft, perhaps. But I am finding it all quite intriguing.
"Hold the cabbage and"... Hmm... I am looking at it wrong again.
Ah! Good fortune today.
Where is this coming from? You've always been a little superstitious, but it's getting out of hand.
It's consistent with my findings so far, Kanchou.
What findings?
This particular symbol - do you see it?
The stick?
A scepter! It has always appeared before a successful battle.
Shigure, that could be anything.
Kanchou, the leaves have not lied to me so far.
The stars did last time.
Oh, no. I had it oriented right the first time!
So what's "three paces left" supposed to mean?
Some great portent, clearly.
I'm not sure what's stranger - your superstitions or the fact that they seem to be working.
I don't question it, Kanchou. I just look for connections.
At least connect a shell with a Morgana.
@BATTLE
Watch now, Kanchou. I expect them to approach from... there.
I don't see anything.
I feel confident in this. Funayūrei are unconventional.
Deceitful, more like.
Only if you are thinking conventionally.
Wait... there they are!
Hai. Shall we?
You're going to have to tell me how you figured them out.
Remind me after they retreat. I have been known to... misplace things.
@BATTLE
All right, what do you know that I don't?
Um... I don't tell people this, but there is an interesting scar on one of my torpedo tubes that--
No. What?! No. No. No... I meant, how did you predict those Morganas' movements?
I wish I could tell you more. All I know is that for all their terror, these demons have... behaviors. Patterns. These patterns have causes.
These causes being stars and tea.
Perhaps that was the wrong word. Symptoms?

Fields.MenuText: I doubt it. You find what you look for.
Sounds like a disease.
Even a broken clock is right twice a day.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't really look for these things. They just... are.
It's a big world, Kanchou. Everything touches everything else in small ways.
It still needs the passage of time to make it right.
Aren't there easier ways to outsmart the enemy?
Maybe. But not all of them involve making tea.
I guess I can't argue with that...
Kanchou, hide me!
From what?
The reporters... they're coming! From Tokyo Shimbun, and all the rest! The newspapers say so!
I'm not surprised. Did you read the after-action reports from that one mission?
"... as if she had telegraphed her movements to Madame Shigure in advance..."
You have to admit, they've got a way with words back at Command.
It's all so... presumptuous.
Presumptuous how? You whipped those Morganas like few others.
It wasn't me, Kanchou... it just wasn't.

Fields.MenuText: Am I supposed to believe it was the stars?
Stop selling yourself short. You're a crack shot and you know it.
Your sisters say otherwise. We say otherwise.

Fields.DialogueText: Symptoms, Kanchou... it was just meant to be this way.
The gods decreed that this would happen. I cannot take credit.
My sisters say many things... and not all of them so complimentary.
Nonsense. You proved yourself with that fake omamori, remember?
It's really nothing you need worry about. Simple pattern recognition, that is all.
Shigure, I--
Matsu! ... Hai! I'm sure of it. They come!
Morganas?
I read their path in a formation of gulls this morning.
If you say so.
@BATTLE
Wait! Kanchou, not one step farther.
What's going on? Is there trouble?
That really depends on your definition of the word.
Are we under attack?
Well, not in the physical sense...
Then stop wasting my time!
Wait! Kanchou, that plainclothes man there. The one enjoying his bland military fare...
The correspondent from Tokyo Shimbun. And what's wrong with the food? You eat it, too.
He is a civilian. He is not used to it. I'm a destroyer. It would be strange if I did not enjoy my own food, wouldn't it?
No stranger than what you Belles usually get up to...
When is his birthday?
What's that got to do with anything?
If I know his sign of birth, then I can learn how best to convince him to leave. He certainly doesn't eat like an Aries...

Fields.MenuText: And how does an Aries eat?
That's a ludicrous idea and you know it.
You'll have to talk to one of them eventually.

Fields.DialogueText: Energetic, occasionally naive... if only it were that easy. See how patiently he cuts his meat?
With respect... I think the Funayūrei would disagree.
I am known for my patience, Kanchou. I can wait for you humans to grow bored.
It's like you don't even want to show the world how skilled you are.
... Is that an option?
Oh, for the love of--
Wait! Distract him so I may defeat our enemy before he notices.
I doubt he'll miss the explosions.
One never knows. I miss the obvious all the time.
You're a special case.
... Arigatō?
@BATTLE
You can't make me.
I know I can't. You're going to do it willingly.
Kanchou, this is time I wanted to spend writing!
He's not going to go away until he gets his story. We might as well clear him out now.
You do not understand. It's not for his sake that I... oh, Kanchou, I can't!
Can't what?
Especially not now. I was in the middle of a verse...

Fields.MenuText: It will still be there when you get back.
Come on. He came aboard specifically to talk to you.
Do you want me to make this an order?

Fields.DialogueText: What if the inspiration is not?
That's precisely why I'm worried!
I cannot explain it... but please understand that I beg you not to.
Shigure...
*ALARM*
Oh, dear... they've come, haven't they?
Convenient.
Hai, I concur.
Do you now?
Hai.
Just do the job, Shigure.
@BATTLE
A-all right, Kanchou... I believe I am ready.
If you're sure.
I know I cannot delay forever. Just let me find my omamori and...
... No. No! Naze imana no ka?
What's going on?
It's gone! And I checked everywhere on my person this time!

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry. At least we know it couldn't have left the ship.
Can't you do without?
Want me to help look for it?

Fields.DialogueText: I sense it, but... in among everything else, I cannot pinpoint it!
Maybe, but I cannot discover that now!
Hai, I would appreciate that. But can we not postpone the interview?
It's the one thing I told myself I would not lose... for success in meeting new people. And now of all times to lose it... even if I find it, it will be bad!
Because when you find something after losing it...
My rage state, Kanchou! I am damned if I do and damned if I do not, as the Americans put it.
Well, when you're calm, we'll look for it again and-
Wait... did you get a new bookmark?
This? Oh, I found it in the corridor just down the hall from... your quarters.
She summits the depths / By summoning their terrors / And drowning the world...
*ALARM*
At least I can point her at something...
@BATTLE
Ugh... nani ga okotta?
Just relax. You've had a rough go of it lately.
Kanchou... why am I on the floor?
You passed out after we drove off those Funayūrei.
And the reporter?
He'll be fine.
Nani?! What do you mean, "he'll be fine?" What happened?

Fields.MenuText: It's really nothing to worry about, Shigure.
You might have... gotten a little rough with him.
He couldn't handle the war. Let's leave it at that.

Fields.DialogueText: You're only making me worry more!
"A little rough!?" That could mean anything!
All the more reason to protect him!
When you went into your... mode... you made a break for the bridge. He was in your way.
I could have killed him! Kanchou, a Kami like me could have destroyed him, if not crippled him for life!
You shoved him into a wall and bruised his shoulder. It was actually a little funny.
Gomen nasai! I used my strength irresponsibly. Who knows what I could have done had I been angrier?
Where are you going?
To atone for my sins against the people I am sworn to defend!
Do not relocate your quarters in a little closet somewhere, Shigure!
Let me be the judge of my crimes! My sisters would never have--
Your sisters are going to be fighting for their lives in minutes. If you're going to atone, atone with them.
I... I suppose it would be better than not acting at all.
But after...
The closet will be there when you get back.
@BATTLE
Ah... that is much better.
You were in there long enough.
Hai. It was getting quite stuffy. Though it did give me the chance to reorganize my dresses.
Don't you always wear the same one?
There are special occasions. Summer festivals... weddings...
You own a wedding dress?
Is... is that wrong?
Not wrong. Just... strange. For a ship, I mean.
But I am a Kami.
I mean... yes, I suppose you're right.
Not that I have acted like one, of late.

Fields.MenuText: Most ships I know don't sulk about their mistakes.
You were concerned for the reporter. I can't blame you for that.
As long as you shoot what you need to shoot, I couldn't care less.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe it would be better if I were just a ship after all.
I am a danger to the crew, Kanchou. To you.
That is all I need to be.
Shigure, stop! I promise I'm not mad.
Shouldn't you be?
Tell me... Do you still do your fasting thing?
Sometimes, when inspiration strikes me for a verse, I can forget to eat. Sometimes I do it just to focus on other things.
You told me once you did that because you wanted to know more about yourself. Your capabilities. Why should your rage state be different?
But if I'm putting lives at risk--
What's more dangerous? Testing your strength or not knowing it?
You don't have to answer that.
I can't. At least... not yet.
*ALARM*
We should go.
After you.
@BATTLE
Sir, the enemy is approaching fast!
To your stations!
@BATTLE
I know you're there.
I've been standing here with you since the battle ended.
I know that. I'm just establishing a foundation.
For?
Facts. Knowledge. The tools with which I can act on the world... or at least within it.
The stars are beautiful. That's a fact.
That is an opinion. But it is one I share.
You're thinking too much.
Such a thing is possible?
It is when you're overthinking certain things. Do you really need to consult the weather to decide on an optimal strategy?
But if you look at the patterns, Kanchou...

Fields.MenuText: You find exactly what you expect to find.
I have. They're misleading.
What if it's raining and your tea tells you it's sunny?

Fields.DialogueText: As observing something changes its nature...
It is an imperfect science, I will admit.
I brewed another pot! I wanted another anyway, so it worked out.
Forget the world for a moment. What do you know about you?
I'm a Shiratsuyu-class destroyer. I prefer to be left alone when I am not working. And... I have a propensity for unrestrained violence.
Why unrestrained?
I wish I knew more, Kanchou... but I have chosen to shy away from it.
Except during your rage state. That's what you should be studying.
It scares me.
When you understand it, it might not.
But what if I'm scared by what I discover?
Then the Morganas will be quaking.
I saw one shiver once! Granted, it might have been heat distortion from her burning deck...
That's the spirit!
What the... WHOA!
Ara iyada! Kanchou, are you all right?
I'm fine. I just tripped over this wire. What's it even doing here?
Oh! I mean... "Take that, you clumsy human!"
What!? I am so confused right now, Shigure.
I knew it wouldn't be convincing. This will never work...
Well, war is distasteful. It hurts. So does making someone trip. Does it not make sense to replicate war on a smaller scale to find that state of mind?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe decommissioning you is starting to make sense.
Not a whole lot, no.
I don't think pranks help you prepare for war.

Fields.DialogueText: From a certain point of view, doesn't everything?
Hmm. The thing is, I was having a wicked sort of fun. Oh, well.
I admit to being skeptical... but then, I am unsure of many things.
You're not a naturally violent person, are you?
In a way I'm glad we've only ever driven the Funayūrei off. It gives them a chance to do the right thing next time.
And blow us up correctly?
Son'na tsumori janakatta. But if I can do terrible things, can't they do good things?
Not worth the risk finding out.
Nor does it seem to be worth the effort to prank you. Although... hehehe.
Are you... laughing? I don't think I've ever seen you laugh out loud.
Your expression was really quite amusing. I would have caught you if necessary... so perhaps the irony is what I find funny.
Glad to be of service.
Well, nevertheless... I think we must get back to work. Maybe I will find a way to tap into my unsavory side in the meantime.
@BATTLE
This ought to be good.
Go, roku, shichi...
Feeling inspired?
Hai! You've caught me in a productive mood, Kanchou.
Productive or messy?
I realize it must seem odd, but the words would not come to me on paper for some reason.
So you're using the walls.
They are my walls.
That my men have to clean.
But they're my walls.
Inspection protocols stand.
In that case I'll have this cleaned up before the day is out. I'll just record it in my journal.
Thank you. So... you've been busy, I see.
Feel free to read it, Kanchou. Normally I do not show off my progress, but I think I can make an exception.
"Upon a graveyard / Fight corpses of steel and fire / To dig graves anew."
Like it?

Fields.MenuText: Define "Like."
Evocative!
What does the crew think?

Fields.DialogueText: To appreciate it for what I set out to accomplish. Though if you see it differently, I would love to know how.
I am glad you agree. And yet... there is something missing.
Truth be told, I do not know. Most of the crew have an understanding with me... or perhaps they prefer to avoid me.
I admit to disappointment. I thought I would feel more...
Murderous?
If you want to put it that bluntly. It just feels... descriptive. I don't feel connected to what I'm writing. Just like with my rage state.
So write about the opposite. You said inspiration comes from strange places.
The opposite!? Oh...
Think about it.
@BATTLE
It's been a while since you've camped out here.
Change of scenery is therapeutic.
It's a strange ship who gets bored of the sea.
I wonder if bears get bored of the forest. Do you think that is why some wander into the cities?
I'd chalk that up to hunger.
Now that you mention it... I do think I could use a meal.
It will be some time before the mess serves another.
Hai, but I haven't for some time.
How long is that?
We'll just say it's been a while, and leave it at that.
You've got that look again, Kanchou.
Like someone's replaced your calligraphy with the same writing in a different shade of black. Nigh imperceptible, and yet vaguely foreign.

Fields.MenuText: You're in a creative mood. I like that.
Are you always this philosophical when you starve?
We need to get some food in you now.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō. I wanted to capitalize on it.
I rather think it is the other way around.
At least let me finish this verse?
You can't fight the Morganas with an empty stomach and a poem.
Anata wa machigatte iru... The poem isn't a particularly violent one.
May I read it?
*ALARM*
Better if read aloud... and I would rather not yell over the alarm.
Come find me when you're ready. You sure you didn't, um, "trip" it on purpose?
Heh... even when perturbed, you see the humor in things. The Funayūrei ought to dislike that!
@BATTLE
I'm not even going to ask about the maple leaves.
Even were I able to answer, I fear it would not satisfy you.
The table's covered in momiji tempura. You're not keeping a secret orchard somewhere?
I just had to make up for the past several days of not eating.
That still doesn't explain things.
Read this, Kanchou. A love poem goes well with these sweet things I have made.
A... love poem?
Hai.
"Our fingers may meet / If only to brush hello / And never entwine."
... What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: Is there more?
It's melancholy for a love poem.
What inspired you?

Fields.DialogueText: I threw out twenty-six before I was satisfied with this one.
Unrequited love is... uh, so I imagine.
Formidable as I am, many things are unattainable. Love being one of them.
I've never shared a poem like this before. You are my first, Kanchou.
I'm honored.
And... oh! Your idea may be just what I needed!
My idea?
To consider ideas contrary to violence during war. It may yet help me in battle.
I was confused, then we were looking into each other's eyes.. and now I'm confused again.
*sigh* Kanchou...
*ALARM*
How disruptive.
@BATTLE
You are still looking into my eyes, Kanchou...
And you're looking into mine.
I am not complaining...
I... I think... Īe!
Shigure!
It's... it's all right, Kanchou. I am not there yet.
Not where? You look exhausted.
My mind was elsewhere?
Again, where?
I was doing some light reading. Here.
A newspaper?
Normally I'm not one to keep up with current events, but... I could not resist.
"Shigure, a Terror to Friend and Foe."
I... wasn't going to share this with you.
That war correspondent must have taken things harder than I thought.

Fields.MenuText: Shigure, that wasn't you that shoved him.
Can you blame him?
You can't hide from the world forever.

Fields.DialogueText: But it was. Just... not a me I usually am.
Not... not really. I only wish I'd had time to tell my side of things.
I don't know if the world will like what it finds.
I'm sorry. I shouldn't have kept this from you.
Think nothing of it, Kanchou. I had enough on my mind then.
So why revisit it now?
Call it state-dependent memory. If I am as troubled now as I was then, it will be a feeling I recognize. And then... I can control my rage state.
How do you feel now?
To tell the truth... sleepy. My eyes wandered to the classifieds and I got bored.
So you're back where you started.
I'm told there's a lawyer in Sendai looking for a typist.
*ALARM*
You may be on to something with the love poems.
On to what?
I will tell you when I find it.
@BATTLE
The harder you are to find, the stranger it is to find you.
I'm not making you uncomfortable, am I?
You're the one out here in the elements.
The wind is calming.
Up the flagpole.
The view is lovely.
I can't leave the ship, so I have to get creative with scenery changes.
Can you at least talk to me down here?
Ano... hai. I have reached the end of this verse, I think.
Ah! There we go. To tell you the truth, the novelty had mostly worn off.
Any luck?
Here... you may decide for yourself.
"Suppose your heart spoke / Your friend and better nature / Resting within you."

Fields.MenuText: Who is it about?
Hearts don't speak, do they?
It's... lovely. Like the author.

Fields.DialogueText: It can be metaphorical... can't it?
Not literally. That I am aware of.
Arigatō. I think so too. Wait, what?! Um...
Is it helping?
I am not forthcoming by nature about these things. But... this does get me closer to learning about myself. Controlling myself. Somehow.
Love poetry as a secret weapon.
I do not want to bring it to bear against the Funayūrei just yet. Not until I have learned to control it. That it is becoming a decision, rather than an impulse... that is something.
So how do you--
*ALARM*
Kiken!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, isn't it lovely? We haven't had the time to enjoy tea together in quite a while.
The weather's not bad out here either. Did you predict this?
Weeks ago I may have bothered to. I haven't really paid attention to the weather patterns recently. Consider this a happy accident.
They say that the best things in life happen when you're not looking for them.
I respectfully disagree.
On what grounds?
Aren't you looking for these things by default? You know and recognize what you want... so you would leap at an opportunity to take it.
What do you want?
It's... well, it's silly.

Fields.MenuText: According to whom?
I've built up a tolerance to silly.
Don't tease me.

Fields.DialogueText: According to... an educated guess on my part. You know how accurate I can be.
I suppose that would be inevitable.
Sumimasen... it is never my intent.
Have you ever read Northanger Abbey?
Why?
One of the British ensigns recommended it. It concerns a girl who reads too many books.
Sounded familiar?
Tashika ni. Good for a first novel. British. It's more or less about separating fantasy from reality. Learning to see what's in front of you.
And what's in front of you?
What I desire.
I feel that way, too, Shigure.
*ALARM*
Metaphorically.
@BATTLE
Have you been standing there all day?
I can see why you might assume that. I do tend to stick in peculiar places for peculiar amounts of time.
In peculiar positions.
Your surroundings are vital to your creative process. They must run their course.
So what brings you up here?
An instinct.
Is it the Morganas? They've made a habit of surprising us lately.
I think I will be the one surprising them today.
Good to-
"The heart skips a beat / Yet the once-unquiet mind / Shall fill in the blank."
@BATTLE
Kanchou?
Whoa! Shigure?
It is only me.
You're... normal? After a battle?
I feel normal. Mostly. Have you ever walked up a flight of stairs and assumed there was one more step than there was, and felt yourself ascending even though you weren't?
You're normal, all right. But... how?
The rage was a fire in me, Kanchou. It smolders still, but... I think I have found a way to starve it. Slowly.

Fields.MenuText: Or shoot it at those Morganas.
Hopefully not completely.
What stokes it?

Fields.DialogueText: That, too.
Never completely.
I am still finding answers.
For the first time, Kanchou... it felt like me out there.
It always was.
Hai... and now I remember it. When this war is over... I may even miss it.
Hmmm... da da da dum...
A little flat on those high notes, but you're on the right track.
Oh, stop it, Kanchou! I am just filling the negative space around me.
Usually you try to occupy as little space as possible.
Ordinarily, but... there is something different in the air today. I feel limited in my own skin. Not trapped, but... restless.
Resounding victory will do that.
Well, it's not all there.
All where?
In my memory. I did not fully lose consciousness as before, but I recall patches of the battle.
Such as?
Did I... really pierce those Funayūrei straight through?
Not stem to stern, but close enough. The crew don't exaggerate by much.
Oh, my... that's, um...

Fields.MenuText: Terrifying?
Incredible?
Take your time.

Fields.DialogueText: I would be lying if I said no, and yet... my heart is still racing.
Do you really think so?
Curse my indecision! I may be here for the rest of the day trying to describe it.
I've never seen a Belle fight so cleanly. You put up a monster of a fight with aplomb.
You know I cannot take all the credit.
You're selling yourself short again.
It is much easier to fight when there is something worth fighting for.
That explains the love poems.
Hai! This feeling, being enamored with someone, is... intoxicating.
Shigure?
Um... She comes for me / Little knowing / That I come for her.
You're off meter.
Nani? I cannot hear you over this impending battle!
@BATTLE
Shigure?
Shigure!
Well, she doesn't seem to be in here. Maybe she's in the mess.
Must have gone dormant. I suppose I'll have to get her books sent to Command for study.
Nani sore!?
Aagh!
Ah! Gomen nasai! Are you hurt, Kanchou?
I'll walk it off. What were you doing in here?
Um... exercising.
Above your door.
It's good for endurance training. I think if you compared my strength to that of the other Kami, you would be pleasantly surprised.

Fields.MenuText: Interesting. You'll have to demonstrate before the whole Fleet.
Someone who reads so much fiction should be a better liar.
How long were you planning on being up there?

Fields.DialogueText: A-all of them? S-surely you jest...
I will have to teach myself that after I am finished learning my rage state.
As long as I needed to, I suppose. You know what I say about learning my limits...
If you need some space, I'll give it to you. You've come this far on your own.
N-no, no, I really have not!
How many times do I have to tell you that you're powerful?
This is not me being humble! This is me confessing to you!
What?
*ALARM*
I'm getting a screwdriver and ripping that thing out myself.
Shigure?
@BATTLE
*KNOCK*
Come in!
Konnichiwa, Kanchou.
Hello, there. Did you find whatever it was you were looking for?
Was I looking for something?
You usually are.
I wish it were that simple. Well, I mean... maybe it is. It does not make sense.
Yes, it does. It always does.
Maybe from a certain point of view.
Precisely. I may not understand you sometimes, but you always have reasons for the things you do. As your captain, I trust that they're good reasons.
Arigatō. My reason for coming to see you today... is to apologize.
For?
I have not been honest with you for... I do not know exactly how long.

Fields.MenuText: You're no liar, Shigure. You might be one of the most honest people I know.
What about?
Your victories speak for themselves.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, stop it. If I am not honest with myself, can I be honest with anyone?
I am still trying to decide exactly what.
They are hollow if the reason for them is false.
I lost my glasses on purpose once, to force my rage state through anger and frustration. Who is to say I have not done the same with my poetry? My... feelings?
That's what you're worried about?
It's such a foreign state of mind... one I have only read about. Is it even mine?
Nobody has a state of mind quite like yours.
Maybe a skirmish will clear it.
@BATTLE
Today, I did something I have not done in some time.
Lost your glasses?
That is not funny.
It's a little funny.
I spoke to my sisters about my... our... situation.
Belles give each other love advice?
We hold within us the culture and memory of our nation dating back to the First Emperor and beyond. Who better to give advice?
There are a few missing steps there, but go on.
One wanted us to get married right away.
Whoa!
Oh, dear. Let me mop up that tea for you.
It's fine. Continue.
Another insists on a respectful professional courtship...
I see. That sounds... formal.
Culminating in a lavish military wedding upon the war's conclusion.
Does she now?
And then there was one of my aunts.
Yes?
She suggested you be drawn and quartered for subverting a faithful servant of His Imperial Majesty.

Fields.MenuText: Your family is an eclectic bunch.
I'm glad she's on our side. I think.
Is that even legal?

Fields.DialogueText: Our differences make us stronger, Kanchou. Perspective is not an only child.
You could not ask for a more dutiful ship. Though... her zeal does unnerve me at times.
Is this?
So I did something else I have not done in some time. I consulted the leaves.
And what do they say?
"Three paces left."
Enlightening.
Not really.
I didn't mean it.
You humans speak so strangely. It is almost as confusing as my own thoughts sometimes.
"Pot, this is Kettle. Pot, this is Kettle. Come in, Pot. Over."
How droll... *giggle*
*ALARM*
Answers from you are always so slow...
I'm working on it.
@BATTLE
Luck... wealth... confidence...
Among other things. Help me? I am working through that pile over there.
Shigure... are these your journals?
I have heard other Kami do this to keep from being stuck in the past.

Fields.MenuText: I know you. You'd never burn a book.
They have their reasons. You have yours.
You're stuck in the present, if anything.

Fields.DialogueText: I used to think I knew myself.
My reasons are not always rational
Isn't that where we all should be?
Please understand, Kanchou. I wish I had an answer. But now I feel the best I can do is to set things right between us.
Things seem fine to me.
Imagine that you feel powerfully for someone, Kanchou. Imagine that this person is with you each day... guiding, helping, trusting you like none other... and you lie to this person!
"Take that, you clumsy human you!" You couldn't lie to me if you tried. That's rare in an ally.
And what about my rage state? Is hiding that not a lie in itself? The more I denied it, the more it would assert control!
So you accepted it. Our feelings are a part of who we are. There's no shame in feeling them.
Which is the greater dishonesty, Kanchou!? Harboring these feelings and keeping them to myself? Or possibly fabricating them to give me something to fight for?
Kanchou...
Did that feel dishonest?
She pulls Cupid's shaft / From her pierced and bleeding breast / To shoot at her foe.
@BATTLE
Burning the omamori?
Look at that sky.
Ever seen it so clear, Kanchou?
I don't know how to describe it. You're the poet.
Like a mirror that ripples in its place on the wall. Beautiful in its shape and its impossibility.
How do you do that?
The same way one does anything, Kanchou... recognizing patterns.
Practice makes perfect.
Anyone can write if they want to. All it really is is seeing connections in the world and inviting others to do the same.
I've heard that sake helps.
A misconception, Kanchou. It is a craft like any other and requires discipline. This sake is merely to celebrate.
What's the occasion?
This world is occasion enough.
You're making a connection.
Our connection. Wherever it came from does not have to be absolute truth or absolute falsehood. It is there, and I like it.

Fields.MenuText: These things aren't always clear-cut.

Fields.DialogueText: I am getting better at accepting a little bit of uncertainty. It's exciting in its own way.
Like a good battle.
I was disappointed in the previous Funayūrei. They seemed so... unanchored.
They didn't have a rakishly charming captain to fight for.
Hush, you.
Er... that is... You may come closer if you like.
About three paces left?
Hai. That will do nicely.

Fields.MenuText: I'll be a straight shooter. I'm in love with you, Shigure.
Keep talking in circles. It's who you are, and I love it.

Fields.DialogueText: So direct! How I envy that quality, but... I will try.
I feel the same way for you, Kanchou.
As your qualities stimulate me... and put a smile on my face!
A few more Morganas to crush! Ready?
I am with you, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
